nmap -sV <target>: Probe open ports to determine service/version info
nmap -O <target>: Determine the OS of the target
nmap -A <target>: Enable OS detection, version detection, script scanning, and traceroute
nmap -sU -sV -sC --script=all <target>: UDP scan with version detection and default scripts
nmap --script-args-file=<file_name> <tar: Provide NSE script args from a file
nmap --script-trace <target>: Show all data sent and received
nmap -iL <input_file>: Scan targets from a list in a file
nmap --excludefile <exclude_file>: Exclude targets using a list in a file
nmap -Pn <target>: Treat all hosts as online -- skip host discovery
nmap --reason <target>: Display the reason a port is in a particular state
nmap --open <target>: Only show open (or possibly open) ports
nmap --packet-trace <target>: Show all packets sent and received
nmap --data-length <size> <target>: Append random data to sent packets
nmap --source-port <port> <target>: Send packets from a specified source port
nmap --max-parallelism <number> <target>: Maximum number of probes in parallel
nmap --max-retries <number> <target>: Set the max number of port scan probe retransmissions
nmap --host-timeout <time> <target>: Give up on target after this long
nmap --script-timeout <time> <target>: The script itself may set a lower timeout
nmap --min-rate <number> <target>: Send packets no slower than <number> per second
nmap --max-rate <number> <target>: Send packets no faster than <number> per second
nmap --badsum <target>: Send packets with a bogus TCP/UDP/SCTP checksum
nmap --data <hex_string> <target>: Append a custom payload to sent packets
nmap --randomize-hosts <target>: Scan the addresses in random order
nmap -sL <target>: List Scan - simply list targets to scan
nmap -PS/PA/PU/PY[portlist] <target>: TCP SYN/ACK, UDP or SCTP discovery to given ports
nmap -PE/PP/PM <target>: ICMP echo, timestamp, and netmask request discovery probes
nmap -n/-R <target>: Never do DNS resolution/Always resolve [default: sometimes]
nmap --traceroute <target>: Trace hop path to each host
nmap --script=ftp-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against FTP servers
nmap --script=http-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against HTTP servers
nmap --script=imap-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against IMAP servers
nmap --script=pop3-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against POP3 servers
nmap --script=smtp-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against SMTP servers
nmap --script=snmp-brute <target>: Perform brute force community string auditing against SNMP servers
nmap --script=ssh-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against SSH servers
nmap --script=telnet-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against Telnet servers
nmap --script=vmauthd-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against VMware Authentication Daemon
nmap --script=vnc-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against VNC servers
nmap --script=xmpp-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against XMPP servers
nmap --script=smb-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against SMB servers
nmap --script=rdp-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against RDP servers
nmap --script=ms-sql-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against Microsoft SQL servers
nmap --script=oracle-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against Oracle servers
nmap --script=mysql-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against MySQL servers
nmap --script=pgsql-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against PostgreSQL servers
nmap --script=mssql-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against MSSQL servers
nmap --script=cisco-enable-brute <target: Perform brute force password auditing against Cisco devices with enabled services
nmap --script=sip-brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against SIP servers
nmap --script=auth <target>: Attempt to bypass authentication for running services
nmap --script=brute <target>: Perform brute force password auditing against services
nmap --script=default <target>: Default set of scripts to reduce target spew
nmap --script=discovery <target>: Attempt to query running services for further information
nmap --script=external <target>: Checks using a list of external scripts
nmap --script=safe <target>: Safe scripts that won't crash the target
nmap --script=version <target>: Attempt to retrieve the version number of a service

nmap --script=banner <target>: Retrieve the banner of the service
nmap --script=http-headers <target>: Retrieve HTTP headers for a target
nmap --script=http-methods <target>: Retrieve HTTP methods supported by a target
nmap --script=http-php-version <target>: Detect PHP version of the target
nmap --script=http-robots.txt <target>: Retrieve robots.txt file from a target
nmap --script=http-security-headers <tar: Retrieve security headers from a target
nmap --script=http-server-header <target: Retrieve server header from a target
nmap --script=http-title <target>: Retrieve the title of the webpage
nmap --script=http-userdir-enum <target>: Enumerate user directories on a target
nmap --script=ms-sql-info <target>: Retrieve information from a Microsoft SQL server
nmap --script=mysql-databases <target>: Retrieve databases from a MySQL server
nmap --script=mysql-empty-password <targ: Test if a MySQL server allows login by an empty password
nmap --script=mysql-info <target>: Retrieve information from a MySQL server
nmap --script=mysql-variables <target>: Retrieve variables from a MySQL server
nmap --script=oracle-tns-version <target: Retrieve TNS version from an Oracle server
nmap --script=smtp-commands <target>: Retrieve SMTP commands from a target
nmap --script=snmp-interfaces <target>: Retrieve interfaces from a SNMP server
nmap --script=telnet-ntlm-info <target>: Retrieve NTLM authentication information from a Telnet server
nmap --script=vulners.nse <target>: Retrieve vulnerabilities from the CVE database
nmap --script=vulscan <target>: Retrieve vulnerabilities from the Nessus vulnerability database
nmap --script=smb-os-discovery <target>: Discover the operating system of a SMB server
nmap --script=smb-security-mode <target>: Retrieve the security mode of a SMB server
nmap --script=smb-server-stats <target>: Retrieve server statistics from a SMB server
nmap --script=smb-system-info <target>: Retrieve system information from a SMB server
nmap --script=snmp-netstat <target>: Retrieve network statistics from a SNMP server
nmap --script=snmp-processes <target>: Retrieve processes from a SNMP server
nmap --script=snmp-sysdescr <target>: Retrieve the system description from a SNMP server
nmap --script=snmp-win32-services <targe: Retrieve Windows services from a SNMP server
nmap --script=snmp-win32-shares <target>: Retrieve Windows shares from a SNMP server
nmap --script=snmp-win32-software <targe: Retrieve Windows software from a SNMP server
nmap --script=snmp-win32-users <target>: Retrieve Windows users from a SNMP server
